definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Early tugboats had steam engines; today diesel engines are used.
sentences.chinese: 早在拖船曾用蒸汽火车头，今天柴油发动机使用。

sentences.english: Shanghai was to become tile economic engine-room which would send China hurtling into the new millennium.
sentences.chinese: 上海要成为中国经济的火车头，带领中国奔向新千年。

sentences.english: The equipment was modified to produce locomotives.
sentences.chinese: 这设备被改作火车头了。

sentences.english: The locomotives in the paintings looks like a group of suicide cetacean rushing towards the shore.
sentences.chinese: 近百张火车头的肖像，象是从海里冲上岸自杀的巨鲸。

sentences.english: Old fashioned locomotive emitting steam, locked onto empty cars.
sentences.chinese: 散发着蒸汽的老式火车头拖拽着空车皮。

sentences.english: The locomotive vomits out vapor when getting started.
sentences.chinese: 火车头启动时喷出大量蒸汽。

sentences.english: When it recovers, it will be like the locomotive that pulls the rest of the train with it.
sentences.chinese: 美国经济一旦复苏，将会像火车头一样带动整列火车。

sentences.english: This kind person is in loco forum, maniac forum has big. Of course.
sentences.chinese: 这类的人在火车头论坛，狂人论坛有大把的。

sentences.english: That song was the old Grand Funk Railroad hit 'Locomotion'.
sentences.chinese: 这是一首老格兰德庞克铁路流行歌“火车头”。

sentences.english: Look what loco does is more and more perfect.
sentences.chinese: 看来火车头做的是越来越完美了。

sentences.english: Old fashioned locomotive and loaded cars standing on dock, emitting steam.
sentences.chinese: 码头上散发着蒸汽的老式火车头和已经装载的车皮。

sentences.english: As for the Koons locomotive, Mr. Suman said that its prospects look good.
sentences.chinese: 至于昆斯的火车头，苏曼表示前景看好。

sentences.english: The locomotive was pulling (or drawing) twelve carriages .
sentences.chinese: 火车头拖着十二个车皮。

definition: locomotive/train engine car/scooter (Tw)/(slang) (Tw) hard to get along with/a pain in the ass/damn!/crap!
to accelerate at full power (idiom); at full speed/fig. to work as hard as possible
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
track (for trains etc)/orbit (of a satellite)/(fig.) a person's established path in life/desired trajectory (of a business or other endeavor)/(audio engineering) track/(quantum mechanics) orbital
